dataElement.name: DataSets
dataElement.annot: TDWG root element: container for one or more DataSets.

dataElement.name: DataSet
dataElement.annot: A dataset containing unit data and their shared metadata elements.

dataElement.name: DatasetGUID
dataElement.annot: A globally unique identifier for the entire data collection the present dataset was derived from. The exact format and/or semantics are still under discussion.

dataElement.name: TechnicalContacts
dataElement.annot: Metadata item normally not used for end-user display. UDDI registry element for GBIF registry. Questions and feedback about availability of a provider or resource should be directed to the technical contact. This contact normally represents the Agent acting as the publisher of the datasets in the network. The element is unbounded to provide for alternative contacts (vacation etc.).

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Person, person team, or role name (e. g., 'head of departement')

dataElement.name: Phone
dataElement.annot: (voice phone)

dataElement.name: ContentContacts
dataElement.annot: UDDI registry element ("AdministrativeContact") for GBIF registry. Questions and feedback about data, or restrictions on use of the data should be directed to the adminstrative contact. This contact normally represents the agent acting as the original supplier or custodian of the dataset. If a content contact is given on the unit-level, that one should be used for end-user purposes. The element is unbounded to provide for alternative contacts (vacation etc.).

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Person, person team, or role name (e. g., 'head of departement')

dataElement.name: Phone
dataElement.annot: (voice phone)

dataElement.name: OtherProviders
dataElement.annot: Other known on-line providers of this dataset.

dataElement.name: OtherProvider
dataElement.annot: The UUID (identifier in the UDDI registry) of another data provider known to serve this dataset.

dataElement.name: Metadata
dataElement.annot: Metadata referring to the principal source of the entire data collection (the metadata scope may be wider than the objects actually contained in the data set). In its current form, this collection represents a mixture of elements useful for resource discovery (e.g. scope) with metadata actually pertaining to the received (partial) dataset.

dataElement.name: Description
dataElement.annot: Dublin Core conformant elements describing the content of the data source queried, representation in different languages possible

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: The description in a specified language. Only one representation should be delivered for each language. [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Title
dataElement.annot: General Note on DublinCore translation: In addition to those that can bee transformed from UBIF metadata, an additional DC.Type='dataset' should be added.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Description": Free-form text containing a longer description of the project.

dataElement.name: Coverage
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Coverage": Free-form text describing geographic, taxonomic, or other coverage aspects of terminology or descriptions available in the current project.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: URL pointing to an online source related to the current project, which may or may not serve an updated version of the description data.

dataElement.name: IconURI
dataElement.annot: The URI of an icon/logo symbolizing the project.

dataElement.name: Scope
dataElement.annot: Keyword lists of geographical, taxonomic, etc. scopes. In the case of projects in progress, 'scope' may define the planned or intended, rather than the achieved scope (or coverage). If scope is given, the content available should be entirely within scope, because this item is for resource discovery purposes. Compare also Coverage in DC.Description (which is language-specific). (Items from Scope may be added to DC.Coverage)

dataElement.name: GeoecologicalTerms
dataElement.annot: A collection of terms describing the geoecological scope of the source queried by means of area names (e.g. 'Worldl', 'Germany', 'Atlantic Ocean', 'Andes', 'Mountains'. A list of recommended terms should be developed.

dataElement.name: TaxonomicTerms
dataElement.annot: A collection of taxon names of higher rank describing the taxonomic scope of the source queried. A list of recommended terms should be developed.

dataElement.name: Version
dataElement.annot: Number and date of current version (particularly for citing purposes)

dataElement.name: Major
dataElement.annot: The major version number ('1' in 1.2) as defined by the content creators.

dataElement.name: Minor
dataElement.annot: An optional minor version number ('2' in 1.2)

dataElement.name: Modifier
dataElement.annot: Unconstrained text specifying status + optional number, e. g., 'beta', 'alpha', 'rc/release candidate', 'internal'. If missing, release status is assumed.

dataElement.name: DateIssued
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element Date.Issued: Citable 'publication date' of the current version (comp. RevisionData/DateCreated and DateModified for version- independent dates). This date should be missing if the current version is not yet published!

dataElement.name: RevisionData
dataElement.annot: Creators, Revision status, and dates of the entire data collection from which the current dataset is derived.

dataElement.name: Creators
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Creators", i.e. Author or editor.

dataElement.name: Contributors
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element"Contributors": General contributors, or translators.

dataElement.name: DateCreated
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element "Date.Created": Date/time when the intellectual content (project, term, description, etc.) was created. Applications may initially set this to the system date for new data objects, but authors must be able to change it to an earlier date if necessary. If for legacy data this is imprecisely known, it may be missing here. Earlier versions in other data formats should then be mentioned in the copyright or acknowl. statements.

dataElement.name: DateModified
dataElement.annot: Source for Dublin-Core standard element Date.Modified: Date/time when the last modification of the object was made. If in online data sources the provider can not assess this, the current date/time may be substituted. For legacy data this may be set to the file date of imported data, or estimated.

dataElement.name: Owners
dataElement.annot: Entities having legal possession of the data collection content. Here defined for the entire data collection, not for individual units. If an owner statement is present on the unit level, it should override this dataset-level statement.

dataElement.name: Owner
dataElement.annot: Entitiy having legal possession of the data collection content.

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: Organisation to contact

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.name: Abbreviation
dataElement.annot: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

dataElement.name: OrgUnits
dataElement.annot: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: OrgUnit
dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: Person
dataElement.annot: Person to contact

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: InheritedName
dataElement.annot: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

dataElement.name: Prefix
dataElement.annot: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

dataElement.name: Suffix
dataElement.annot: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.annot: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

dataElement.name: Addresses
dataElement.annot: Contact addresses (one preferred, different languages possible)

dataElement.name: Address
dataElement.annot: Contact address as string.

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumbers
dataElement.annot: Telephone and fax numbers

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumber
dataElement.annot: Telephone or fax number

dataElement.name: Number
dataElement.annot: Full number in standard international format

dataElement.name: UsageNotes
dataElement.annot: Free text for constraints on use e.g. "weekdays only" or "home number"

dataElement.name: EmailAddresses
dataElement.annot: E-mail addresses

dataElement.name: EmailAddress
dataElement.annot: E-mail address for contact

dataElement.name: URIs
dataElement.annot: URIs for person or organisation

dataElement.name: URL
dataElement.annot: URI for person or organisation

dataElement.name: LogoURI
dataElement.annot: URL of a logo image.

dataElement.name: IPRStatements
dataElement.annot: Copyright, terms of use, license and other IPR-related statements like disclaimer or acknowledgement. Giving a copyright statement and a (if possible public) licence is highly recommended! (=DC.Rights)

dataElement.name: IPRDeclarations
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: IPRDeclaration
dataElement.annot: Used where the IPR declaration cannot be parsed into the specific items or for forms of IPR declaration not yet covered (e.g. database rights),

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Copyrights
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Copyright
dataElement.annot: Copyright may include the information that the data has been released to the public domain.

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Licenses
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: License
dataElement.annot: To be used if data are placed under a public license (GPL, GFDL, OpenDocument). Placing data under a public license while maintaining copyright is recommended!

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: TermsOfUseStatements
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: TermsOfUse
dataElement.annot: Defines conditions under which the data may be analised, distributed or changed. "Terms of use" includes concepts like "Usage conditions" and "Specific Restrictions".

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Disclaimers
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Disclaimer
dataElement.annot: Disclaimer statement, e.Â g. concerning responsibility for data quality or legal implications.

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Acknowledgements
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Acknowledgement
dataElement.annot: A free form text acknowledging support (e. g. grant money, help, permission to reuse published material, etc.)

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Citations
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Citation
dataElement.annot: Indicates how this dataset or record should be attributed if used [OBIF 1.0]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Units
dataElement.annot: A container for one or more unit data records from the gathering

dataElement.name: Unit
dataElement.annot: A container for all data referring to a unit (specimen or observation record)

dataElement.name: UnitGUID
dataElement.annot: A globally unique identifier for the unit or the unit record. The exact format and/or semantics are still under discussion.

dataElement.name: SourceInstitutionID
dataElement.annot: Unique identifier (code or name) of the institution holding the original data source (first part of record identifier). In specimen collections, this is normally the institution or private holder of the collection itself. For herbaria and botanical gardens, the standard abbreviations should be used.

dataElement.name: SourceID
dataElement.annot: Name or code of the data source (unique within the institution, second part of the record identifier)

dataElement.name: UnitID
dataElement.annot: A unique identifier for the unit record within the data source. Preferrably, the ID should be stable in the database, so that it also can be used to find the same record again (e.g. for data exchange purposes). Third part of the record identifier.

dataElement.name: UnitIDNumeric
dataElement.annot: Numeric catalogue number. Facilitates soriting of numbers.

dataElement.name: LastEditor
dataElement.annot: Name or other indication of the person or team that created or last edited this record.

dataElement.name: DateLastEdited
dataElement.annot: Date of creation or last change of this unit record.

dataElement.name: Owner
dataElement.annot: The legal owner of the unit record. Note that ownership of physical specimens is handled under SpecimenUnit. If present, overrides the equivalent Ownders element on the level of dataset.

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: Organisation to contact

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: SourceReference
dataElement.annot: Reference that is the source of the information about the unit given in the record.

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: UnitReferences
dataElement.annot: Container element for references citing the unit See SourceReference for the case that the record is based on a publication.

dataElement.name: UnitReference
dataElement.annot: Published reference citing this unit.

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: Identifications
dataElement.annot: Container element for identification events, i.e. the circumstances and result of assigning a name to the unit.

dataElement.name: Identification
dataElement.annot: In cases where more than one name applies to a single unit, several identifications should be formed and flagged as preferred. Relationships between differently identified sub-units of the unit can be specified by means of the IdentificationRole.

dataElement.name: Result
dataElement.annot: The result of the identification, currently either a material (substrate) or a taxon name, but in the future to be extended to include other types of identifications used in natural history collections and surveys.

dataElement.name: TaxonIdentified
dataElement.annot: The Taxon (concept) or Taxonomic name assigned to the unit (or excluded, "non") in the Identification.

dataElement.name: HigherTaxa
dataElement.annot: Wrapper element for multiple designations of higher taxa. These are higher-level classifications of the name identified, NOT a higher taxon as the sole identification.

dataElement.name: HigherTaxon
dataElement.annot: The scientific name of a taxon with a rank higher than Genus which is commonly used to classify the group the unit belongs to.

dataElement.name: ScientificName
dataElement.annot: Name of the taxon identified, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names - with additional elements for suffixes or other expressions commonly used in taxonomic identifications.

dataElement.name: FullScientificNameString
dataElement.annot: Concatenated scientific name, preferrably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature, i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author(s) or author team(s) and - where relevant - year, or the name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula, as fully as possible.

dataElement.name: NameAtomised
dataElement.annot: Atomised data items of the taxon identified, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

dataElement.name: Bacterial
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Nomenclature of Prokaryotes

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus name.

dataElement.name: Subgenus
dataElement.annot: Subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SubgenusAuthorAndYear
dataElement.annot: Author team and year of the subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SpeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Species epithet

dataElement.name: SubspeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Subspecies

dataElement.name: ParentheticalAuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: Author team and Year of the basionym of a species or subspecies combination.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: The author(s) who published the full name as it stands and its year.

dataElement.name: NameApprobation
dataElement.annot: Approbation of name according to approved list, validation list,or validly published, paper in IJSB after 1980.

dataElement.name: Botanical
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name.

dataElement.name: FirstEpithet
dataElement.annot: The first epithet in a botanical name combination (species epithet or the epithet of the subdivision of a genus.

dataElement.name: InfraspecificEpithet
dataElement.annot: The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank.

dataElement.name: Rank
dataElement.annot: The rank of the name where needed to form it.

dataElement.name: HybridFlag
dataElement.annot: Flag indicating that this is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamParenthesis
dataElement.annot: Author team of the basionym of a combination.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeam
dataElement.annot: The author(s) who published the full name as it stands.

dataElement.name: CultivarGroupName
dataElement.annot: Cultivar group name

dataElement.name: CultivarName
dataElement.annot: Cultivar name according to the ICNCP.

dataElement.name: TradeDesignationNames
dataElement.annot: Container for trade names

dataElement.name: TradeDesignationName
dataElement.annot: Trade name used for a specific cultivar

dataElement.name: Zoological
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name.

dataElement.name: Subgenus
dataElement.annot: Subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SpeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Species epithet

dataElement.name: SubspeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Subspecies

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamOriginalAndYear
dataElement.annot: The first person(s) who validly published a species-group name and the year of publication.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamParenthesisAndYear
dataElement.annot: The parenthetical citation of the original author when a species-group was transferred to another genus and the year of the original publication.

dataElement.name: CombinationAuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination and the year of its publication.

dataElement.name: Breed
dataElement.annot: Name of the breed of an animal

dataElement.name: Viral
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name formed according to the code and representing the result of the identification. E.g. Comovirus.

dataElement.name: ViralSpeciesDesignation
dataElement.annot: The formal name of a viral species. Examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1 [Source: ICTV].

dataElement.name: Acronym
dataElement.annot: The accepted acronym for the Virus, e.g. PCV for Peanut Clump Virus.

dataElement.name: IdentificationQualifier
dataElement.annot: A term to qualify the identification of the unit when doubts have arisen as to its identity (e.g. "cf." or "aff."). If it applies to an atomised name, the attribute insertionpoint defines the name element in front of which the qualifier should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before second epithet.)

dataElement.name: NameAddendum
dataElement.annot: A free-text suffix added to the taxon identified (e.g. "sensu lato"), or an additional name element in common use but without formal nomenclatural standing (e.g. Isolate names for viruses).

dataElement.name: InformalNameString
dataElement.annot: The outcome of an identification event that does not adhere to the rule of a Code of Nomenclature.

dataElement.name: NameComments
dataElement.annot: Any free text comments related to the name

dataElement.name: Code
dataElement.annot: The Code of Nomenclature that applies to the scientific name.

dataElement.name: MaterialIdentified
dataElement.annot: A material identified as the result of the identification event (e.g. a non-organismic substrate of a microorganism)

dataElement.name: PreferredFlag
dataElement.annot: True to designate current identification.

dataElement.name: NonFlag
dataElement.annot: True to designate negative identifications.

dataElement.name: StoredUnderFlag
dataElement.annot: True to designate the idenfication under which the entire unit is stored (in a physical collection) or otherwise preferrably referenced.

dataElement.name: ResultRole
dataElement.annot: Used to designate the role of the identification result (e.g. substrate, isolate, host, parasite, etc.)

dataElement.name: Identifier
dataElement.annot: Atomized record of individual, team member, or organization that made the identification.

dataElement.name: PersonName
dataElement.annot: Atomised data for the parts of the Identifier's name.

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: InheritedName
dataElement.annot: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

dataElement.name: Prefix
dataElement.annot: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

dataElement.name: Suffix
dataElement.annot: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: The Organisation the Identifier is affiliated with, or the Organisation (institution) acting as the identifier.

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.name: Abbreviation
dataElement.annot: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

dataElement.name: OrgUnits
dataElement.annot: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: OrgUnit
dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: IdentifiersText
dataElement.annot: Alternatve text indicating the person, person team, or Organization that made the identification.

dataElement.name: IdentificationSource
dataElement.annot: A reference which has provided the identification (and - if present - the identifier's name and/or organisation). The entire identification event was taken from the literature or comparable source given here. Note that this is not the literature (e.g. key) used to obtain the result (see IdentificationReferences).

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: IdentifierRole
dataElement.annot: Indication of the nature of the taxonomic verification; e.g. "conf." or "det."

dataElement.name: References
dataElement.annot: References that were used by the identifier to provide the identification (e.g. by means of providing a key or a description of the taxon). It circumscribes the taxon identified (and thus can act as a potential taxon's sec. reference). Note: this is not the citation from which and identification was taken, see under Identifier/IdentificationSource.

dataElement.name: Reference
dataElement.annot: A reference (e.g. an article or monograph) that was used as the base for the identifier's taxon identification (e.g. by means of providing a key or a description of the taxon). It circumscribes the taxon identified (and thus can act as a potential taxon's sec. reference). Note: this is not the citation from which and identification was taken, see under Identifier/IdentificationSource.

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.annot: Date of the identification event.

dataElement.name: DateText
dataElement.annot: The date in text format

dataElement.name: TimeZone
dataElement.annot: The time zone to which the time-of-day data refer

dataElement.name: ISODateTimeBegin
dataElement.annot: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

dataElement.name: DayNumberBegin
dataElement.annot: Julian day number in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period

dataElement.name: TimeOfDayBegin
dataElement.annot: Time of day in hours from midnight for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period

dataElement.name: ISODateTimeEnd
dataElement.annot: The end of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

dataElement.name: DayNumberEnd
dataElement.annot: The Julian day number of the last day in a period.

dataElement.name: TimeOfDayEnd
dataElement.annot: Time of day in hours from midnight for the end of a time period

dataElement.name: PeriodExplicit
dataElement.annot: Set to True if the event takes place for the period indicated, set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, not filled if unknown or no period specified.

dataElement.name: Method
dataElement.annot: The method by which the identification was obtained, e.g. details of molecular analysis or acoustical procedures.

dataElement.name: Notes
dataElement.annot: Supplementary remarks about the identification.

dataElement.name: VerificationLevel
dataElement.annot: The level to which the identification has been verified. Different standards may use different values here. See ITF-2 for an example.

dataElement.name: IdentificationHistory
dataElement.annot: This is a free text field for use when extracting data from datasources where the identification or verification history (or part of it) is a free text field. In normal circumstances the history can be constructed by sorting identification events by date and reference to the preferred identification flag

dataElement.name: RecordBasis
dataElement.annot: An indication of what the unit record describes. Note that the element SourceReference provides for the case that the record is based on a publication.

dataElement.name: KindOfUnit
dataElement.annot: Part(s) of organism or class of materials represented by this unit.

dataElement.name: SpecimenUnit
dataElement.annot: A Unit subtype containing data elements specific to specimens (living, fossil, or preserved).

dataElement.name: Owner
dataElement.annot: The legal owner or holder of the physical specimen

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: Organisation to contact

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.annot: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

dataElement.name: OrgUnit
dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: Person
dataElement.annot: Person to contact

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.annot: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

dataElement.name: Addresses
dataElement.annot: Contact addresses (one preferred, different languages possible)

dataElement.name: Address
dataElement.annot: Contact address as string.

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumbers
dataElement.annot: Telephone and fax numbers

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumber
dataElement.annot: Telephone or fax number

dataElement.name: Number
dataElement.annot: Full number in standard international format

dataElement.name: UsageNotes
dataElement.annot: Free text for constraints on use e.g. "weekdays only" or "home number"

dataElement.name: EmailAddresses
dataElement.annot: E-mail addresses

dataElement.name: EmailAddress
dataElement.annot: E-mail address for contact

dataElement.name: URIs
dataElement.annot: URIs for person or organisation

dataElement.name: URL
dataElement.annot: URI for person or organisation

dataElement.name: LogoURI
dataElement.annot: URL of a logo image.

dataElement.name: Acquisition
dataElement.annot: Acquisition date, source and type.

dataElement.name: AcquisitionDate
dataElement.annot: Textual statement of the date of acquisition of the specimen by the institution

dataElement.name: AcquisitionSourceText
dataElement.annot: Free text field for informal recording of acquisition source details.

dataElement.name: AcquisitionType
dataElement.annot: Type of acquisition.

dataElement.name: AcquiredFrom
dataElement.annot: Name of person and/or organisation the unit was acquired from (e.g. depositor of a strain).

dataElement.name: AccessionNumber
dataElement.annot: The institutional number applied to an accession and recorded in the accessions register.

dataElement.name: Preparations
dataElement.annot: Specimen preparation details, possibly a sequence of preparation steps

dataElement.name: Preparation

dataElement.name: PreparationProcess
dataElement.annot: Process used in preparing the specimen.

dataElement.name: PreparationMaterials
dataElement.annot: Materials and chemicals used in the preparation of the specimen.

dataElement.name: PreparationAgent
dataElement.annot: Person and/or institution responsible for or effecting the preparation.

dataElement.name: Mark

dataElement.name: MarkText
dataElement.annot: Text transcription of an inscription

dataElement.name: PositionOnObject
dataElement.annot: Position of inscription, writing or mark.

dataElement.name: MarkAuthor
dataElement.annot: Name of person who created the label, writing or inscription.

dataElement.name: MarkComment
dataElement.annot: Summary, interpretation or opinion of the text.

dataElement.name: Images
dataElement.annot: References to an image or images of the label or inscription

dataElement.name: ImageID
dataElement.annot: The ID of a multimedia object representing the image of the mark

dataElement.name: History
dataElement.annot: A wrapper for previous units.

dataElement.name: PreviousUnit
dataElement.annot: A container for past ID and location of this specimen.

dataElement.name: PreviousSourceID
dataElement.annot: Name or code of collection previously holding this specimen.

dataElement.name: PreviousUnitID
dataElement.annot: Identifier of specimen in previous collection.

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.annot: Dates that the specimen was held in previous collection.

dataElement.name: DateText
dataElement.annot: The date in text format

dataElement.name: TimeZone
dataElement.annot: The time zone to which the time-of-day data refer

dataElement.name: ISODateTimeBegin

dataElement.name: DayNumberBegin

dataElement.name: TimeOfDayBegin
