dataElement.name: ISODateTimeEnd
dataElement.annot: The end of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

dataElement.name: DayNumberEnd
dataElement.annot: The Julian day number of the last day in a period.

dataElement.name: TimeOfDayEnd
dataElement.annot: Time of day in hours from midnight for the end of a time period

dataElement.name: PeriodExplicit
dataElement.annot: Set to True if the event takes place for the period indicated, set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, not filled if unknown or no period specified.

dataElement.name: Comment
dataElement.annot: Any further information about this specimen in its previous collection.

dataElement.name: PreviousUnitText
dataElement.annot: An alternative text identifying the previous unit when no ABCD standard ID s can be assigned.

dataElement.name: NomenclaturalTypeDesignation
dataElement.annot: Information on the type status of the specimen.

dataElement.name: TypifiedName
dataElement.annot: The name based on the specimen.

dataElement.name: FullScientificNameString
dataElement.annot: Concatenated scientific name, preferrably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature, i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author(s) or author team(s) and - where relevant - year, or the name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula, as fully as possible.

dataElement.name: NameAtomised
dataElement.annot: Atomised data items of the taxon identified, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

dataElement.name: Bacterial
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Nomenclature of Prokaryotes

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus name.

dataElement.name: Subgenus
dataElement.annot: Subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SubgenusAuthorAndYear
dataElement.annot: Author team and year of the subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SpeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Species epithet

dataElement.name: SubspeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Subspecies

dataElement.name: ParentheticalAuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: Author team and Year of the basionym of a species or subspecies combination.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: The author(s) who published the full name as it stands and its year.

dataElement.name: NameApprobation
dataElement.annot: Approbation of name according to approved list, validation list,or validly published, paper in IJSB after 1980.

dataElement.name: Botanical
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name.

dataElement.name: FirstEpithet
dataElement.annot: The first epithet in a botanical name combination (species epithet or the epithet of the subdivision of a genus.

dataElement.name: InfraspecificEpithet
dataElement.annot: The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank.

dataElement.name: Rank
dataElement.annot: The rank of the name where needed to form it.

dataElement.name: HybridFlag
dataElement.annot: Flag indicating that this is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamParenthesis
dataElement.annot: Author team of the basionym of a combination.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeam
dataElement.annot: The author(s) who published the full name as it stands.

dataElement.name: CultivarGroupName
dataElement.annot: Cultivar group name

dataElement.name: CultivarName
dataElement.annot: Cultivar name according to the ICNCP.

dataElement.name: TradeDesignationNames
dataElement.annot: Container for trade names

dataElement.name: TradeDesignationName
dataElement.annot: Trade name used for a specific cultivar

dataElement.name: Zoological
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name.

dataElement.name: Subgenus
dataElement.annot: Subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SpeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Species epithet

dataElement.name: SubspeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Subspecies

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamOriginalAndYear
dataElement.annot: The first person(s) who validly published a species-group name and the year of publication.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamParenthesisAndYear
dataElement.annot: The parenthetical citation of the original author when a species-group was transferred to another genus and the year of the original publication.

dataElement.name: CombinationAuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination and the year of its publication.

dataElement.name: Breed
dataElement.annot: Name of the breed of an animal

dataElement.name: Viral
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name formed according to the code and representing the result of the identification. E.g. Comovirus.

dataElement.name: ViralSpeciesDesignation
dataElement.annot: The formal name of a viral species. Examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1 [Source: ICTV].

dataElement.name: Acronym
dataElement.annot: The accepted acronym for the Virus, e.g. PCV for Peanut Clump Virus.

dataElement.name: NomenclaturalReference
dataElement.annot: Published reference.

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: TypeStatus
dataElement.annot: Full term designating the status.

dataElement.name: CodeAssessment
dataElement.annot: Indication whether the type is conserved or rejected/suppressed by the Code or is proposed for conservation or suppression/rejection

dataElement.name: DoubtfulFlag
dataElement.annot: Indicator for unverified type status (kind and fact).

dataElement.name: Verifier
dataElement.annot: The person assigning or verifying the type status of the specimen.

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: InheritedName
dataElement.annot: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

dataElement.name: Prefix
dataElement.annot: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

dataElement.name: Suffix
dataElement.annot: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: VerificationDate
dataElement.annot: Date of verification.

dataElement.name: VerificationNotes
dataElement.annot: Further information about the verification process.

dataElement.name: DuplicatesDistributedTo
dataElement.annot: A free text field to note the known other recipients of a duplicate of the unit, preferrably in the form of a delimited list of SourceInstitionIDs.

dataElement.name: Disposition
dataElement.annot: DwC curatorial extension r. 14: 'The current disposition of the cataloged item. Examples: "in collection", "missing", "voucher elsewhere", "duplicates elsewhere".'

dataElement.name: ObservationUnit
dataElement.annot: Data elements specific to observation (recording) units. Note that most observation data items are site related and thus covered under Gathering.

dataElement.name: ObservationUnitIdentifier
dataElement.annot: Numbers or other registration mark associated with an observation record. Attribute for PreferredFlag. Separated from the equivalent AccessionNumber of specimen collections because of the more standardised approaches taken in physical collections.

dataElement.name: CultureCollectionUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to microbial and similar culture methods.

dataElement.name: OrganismType
dataElement.annot: E.g. "Bacteria" or "Archaea"

dataElement.name: InfrasubspecificName
dataElement.annot: Variety designation, epithet, authors and reference. This field excludes the pathovar name and the serovar name, which are both infrasubspecific names but are to be entered under Identification/... ../FullScientificName

dataElement.name: CultureNames
dataElement.annot: Container element for names under which the culture is known

dataElement.name: CultureName
dataElement.annot: Reference or trade name for a microbial culture

dataElement.name: Strain
dataElement.annot: Name of a microbial or viral strain. Note that this name may also denote the unique identifier of the record in the collection, in which case it should also be used for UnitID.

dataElement.name: SerovarOrSerotype
dataElement.annot: Name and author of serovar or serotype

dataElement.name: Pathovar
dataElement.annot: Name and author of the pathovar.

dataElement.name: Mutant
dataElement.annot: Type and parent of mutant if strain is a mutant strain

dataElement.name: Genotype
dataElement.annot: Names of chromosomal markers of the strain. Especially recommended for strains of species for which many genetically modified strains exist

dataElement.name: GrowthConditions
dataElement.annot: An alternative full text field for culture medium, atmospheric and light conditions, temperature conditions and additional remarks on the cultivation.

dataElement.name: CultureMedium
dataElement.annot: The growth medium for a microbial or similar culture e.g. agar

dataElement.name: Temperature
dataElement.annot: Preferably a number - attribute gives temperature scale used

dataElement.name: References
dataElement.annot: References for the culture conditions and method or for a description of the strain

dataElement.name: Reference
dataElement.annot: Attribute for RefType

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: FormOfSupply
dataElement.annot: Form in which the strain will be sent to the customer

dataElement.name: MycologicalUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to mycological and lichenological units.

dataElement.name: LichenMorphotype
dataElement.annot: Name of algal or cyanobacterial component of lichen

dataElement.name: MycologicalLiveStages
dataElement.annot: Spore states present in the sample.

dataElement.name: MycologicalLiveStage
dataElement.annot: Spore states present in the sample.

dataElement.name: HerbariumUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to herbarium specimens (incl. mycological specimens).

dataElement.name: Exsiccatum
dataElement.annot: Information relating this specimen to an Exsiccatum

dataElement.name: DuplicatesDistributedTo
dataElement.annot: A list of collection abbreviations of the herbaria duplicates were distributed to

dataElement.name: LoanIdentifier
dataElement.annot: The unique institutional loan number applied with the loan sequence number to uniquely identify a specimen on loan [HISPID3].

dataElement.name: LoanSequenceNo
dataElement.annot: The sequence of a specimen within a given loan, assigned with the Loan Identification to uniquely identify a specimen on loan [HISPID3]

dataElement.name: LoanDestination
dataElement.annot: Institution to which the loan is being sent [HISPID3]

dataElement.name: LoanForBotanist
dataElement.annot: Name of botanist for whom the loan is destined [HISPID3]

dataElement.name: LoanDespatchMethod
dataElement.annot: The means by which the loan is being despatched from the home institution [HISPID3]

dataElement.name: LoanDate
dataElement.annot: The date the loan is prepared and/or sent [HISPID3]

dataElement.name: NaturalOccurrence
dataElement.annot: Equivalent to HISPID:posnat field: records whether the plant is a native of the collection habitat or whether it is a naturalised introduction. It is expected that this field will have values similar to the following: Natural, Naturalised, Unknown

dataElement.name: CultivatedOccurrence
dataElement.annot: Equivalent to HISPID:poscul field: records whether the plant is established or not established (hence, only maintained as a cultivated plant), in the collection habitat. It is expected that this field will have values similar to the following: Cultivated, Not cultivated, Unknown

dataElement.name: BotanicalGardenUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to units in botanical live (horticultural) collections.

dataElement.name: AccessionSpecimenNumbers
dataElement.annot: Minimum numbers of individuals the garden is holding under the UnitID.

dataElement.name: AccessionStatus
dataElement.annot: Current status (current or not current) of the accession in the garden.

dataElement.name: LocationInGarden
dataElement.annot: Current location of the living plant in the botanical garden.

dataElement.name: AccessionMaterialType
dataElement.annot: Type of material the current living accession is composed of.

dataElement.name: Hardiness
dataElement.annot: A flag indicating that the accession is grown outdoors in the botanical garden.

dataElement.name: ProvenanceCategory
dataElement.annot: A code to indicate the provenance of the accession [ITF-2].

dataElement.name: PropagationHistoryCode
dataElement.annot: A code to indicate the nature of the production of the plant material being accessioned, for use in association with the element ProvenanceCategory [ITF-2]

dataElement.name: AccessionLineage
dataElement.annot: The purpose of this element is to trace the lineage of an accession to either one or two immediate parent unit ID's.

dataElement.name: DonorCategory
dataElement.annot: A code to indicate the type of the immediate donor from which the accession was obtained. This may not be necessarily the original collector of wild material. [ITF-2]

dataElement.name: Cultivation
dataElement.annot: Allows for cultivation information to be passed as free text in order to help the receiving garden care for the transferred accession [ITF-2] or to record the garden's experience made with this accession.

dataElement.name: PlantingDate
dataElement.annot: The date the plant was planted at its current location in the botanical garden.

dataElement.name: Propagation
dataElement.annot: Allows for information about any propagation requirements to be passed as free text in order to help the receiving garden propagate the transferred accession [ITF-2] or to record the garden's experience made with this accession.

dataElement.name: Perennation
dataElement.annot: A code to indicate the means of perennation, providing a means of noting living plant accessions that require regular curatorial monitoring [ITF-2].

dataElement.name: BreedingSystem
dataElement.annot: A code to indicate the breeding system of the accession [ITF-2].

dataElement.name: IPEN
dataElement.annot: Unique number given to plant materials accessioned in conformance with the rules of the International Plant Exchange Network (see http://www.bgci.org/abs/ipen_numbers.html).

dataElement.name: PlantGeneticResourcesUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to units in plant genetic resource collections, e.g. gene banks.

dataElement.name: NationalInventoryCode
dataElement.annot: A designation specific to EURISCO.

dataElement.name: BreedingInstitutionCode
dataElement.annot: FAO Institute Code of the institute that has bred the material.

dataElement.name: BreedingCountryCode
dataElement.annot: ISO 3-letter code for the country where the breeding institute is located.

dataElement.name: GatheringInstitutionCode
dataElement.annot: FAO Institute Code of the institute that has collected the material.

dataElement.name: AccessionName
dataElement.annot: A name given to the accession that cannot be covered by the name structure given for botanical names under identification (i.e. not a formal cultivar or trade designation name).

dataElement.name: AccessionNameText
dataElement.annot: An alternative concatenated text representation of the Accession Names.

dataElement.name: ZoologicalUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to zoological units.

dataElement.name: PhasesOrStages
dataElement.annot: Container element for the phase or stage of the individual organism or the organisms present in the unit. Note that counts can be provided in the Unit's MeasurementsOrFacts section.

dataElement.name: PhaseOrStage
dataElement.annot: Combined element for phase (e.g. polyp and meduse of the Cnidaria) or stage (juvenile, nauplius, copepodite) of the organism(s) in the unit.

dataElement.name: PalaeontologicalUnit
dataElement.annot: Data specific to palaeontological units.

dataElement.name: Preservation
dataElement.annot: Description of the fossil preservation of the specimen.

dataElement.name: Form
dataElement.annot: Original, mould, cast etc

dataElement.name: Matrix
dataElement.annot: The sediment or mineral matrix enclosing the fossil

dataElement.name: Mineralisation
dataElement.annot: Form of mineralisation

dataElement.name: Taphonomy
dataElement.annot: Life position, allochthonous death assemblage, post mortem history details etc.

dataElement.name: TimeRange
dataElement.annot: Known or assumed time range of a fossil

dataElement.name: MultiMediaObjects
dataElement.annot: Multimedia objects such as images, movies, etc. relating to (or forming) the unit. Note that RecordBasis should be set accordingly if the multimedia object actually is the unit in the collection (e.g. collections of images taken in the field, sound recordings, etc.).

dataElement.name: ID
dataElement.annot: Identifier for the multimedia object. May be a filename.

dataElement.name: FileURI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier of the underlying multimedia file, i.e. "naked" path to electronic source of multimedia object (e.g. web address). See also

dataElement.name: ProductURI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier of an electronic source of multimedia object including HTML, Javascript or similar means deliver rendered output.

dataElement.name: Context
dataElement.annot: The context of the object in relation to the specimen or observation. E.g. image of entire specimen, sound recording the observation is based on, image of original valid publication, etc.

dataElement.name: Format
dataElement.annot: Code or descriptive term for file or object format e.g. jpg, pcx, tiff for digital images; 16mm, beta video, AVI, mpg for moving images; transparency, print for photographs etc.

dataElement.name: ImageSize
dataElement.annot: Image size in pixels x pixels.

dataElement.name: Width
dataElement.annot: Picture width in pixel

dataElement.name: Height
dataElement.annot: Picture height in pixel

dataElement.name: ImageResolution
dataElement.annot: Resolution expressed in dots per inch.

dataElement.name: FileSize
dataElement.annot: Size in Kb of the file referred to by URI or filename.

dataElement.name: IPR
dataElement.annot: Intellectual Property Rights relating specifically to the image.

dataElement.name: IPRDeclarations
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: IPRDeclaration
dataElement.annot: Used where the IPR declaration cannot be parsed into the specific items or for forms of IPR declaration not yet covered (e.g. database rights),

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Copyrights
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Copyright
dataElement.annot: Copyright may include the information that the data has been released to the public domain.

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Licenses
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: License
dataElement.annot: To be used if data are placed under a public license (GPL, GFDL, OpenDocument). Placing data under a public license while maintaining copyright is recommended!

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: TermsOfUseStatements
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: TermsOfUse
dataElement.annot: Defines conditions under which the data may be analised, distributed or changed. "Terms of use" includes concepts like "Usage conditions" and "Specific Restrictions".

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Disclaimers
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Disclaimer
dataElement.annot: Disclaimer statement, e.Â g. concerning responsibility for data quality or legal implications.

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Acknowledgements
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Acknowledgement
dataElement.annot: A free form text acknowledging support (e. g. grant money, help, permission to reuse published material, etc.)

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Citations
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Citation
dataElement.annot: Indicates how this dataset or record should be attributed if used [OBIF 1.0]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Comment
dataElement.annot: Free text of formatted text (rtf) description of the feature - not controlled length e.g. often a memo field

dataElement.name: CreatedDate
dataElement.annot: Date the object was created.

dataElement.name: Creator
dataElement.annot: Identifier, e.g. name or other id, of (technical) personnel who has taken the image. Does not imply copyrights or other rights.

dataElement.name: CaptureEquipment
dataElement.annot: Equipment used to create this multimedia object.

dataElement.name: ImageColorSpace
dataElement.annot: ## Element under discussion ## See Bob Morris' comments under http://efgblade.cs.umb.edu/twiki/bin/view/BDEI/ColorManagement

dataElement.name: Associations
dataElement.annot: Relationships of this unit record with other unit records in ABCD conformant datasets.

dataElement.name: UnitAssociation
dataElement.annot: A binary relationship or association of units.

dataElement.name: AssociatedUnitSourceInstitutionCode
dataElement.annot: First part of a fully qualified identifier of a related item's dataset.

dataElement.name: AssociatedUnitSourceName
dataElement.annot: Second part of a fully qualified identifier of a related item's dataset.

dataElement.name: AssociatedUnitID
dataElement.annot: Fully qualified identifier of the related item within the specified dataset.

dataElement.name: AssociationType
dataElement.annot: Description of the association.

dataElement.name: Comment
dataElement.annot: Further information about an association.

dataElement.name: Assemblages
dataElement.annot: A container for groupings of this unit record with other unit records in this dataset by means of an additional ID.

dataElement.name: UnitAssemblage
dataElement.annot: A unit assemblage handles symmetric relationships between several units.

dataElement.name: AssemblageID
dataElement.annot: Identifier for assemblage.

dataElement.name: AssemblageName
dataElement.annot: Name of assemblage.

dataElement.name: NamedCollectionsOrSurveys
dataElement.annot: Unit may belong to one or several collections or survey projects which have distinctive names and do not correspond to the SourceName. Note that this element refers to the name accepted by the specimen or data holding institution, this may or may not be different from the project name given under Gathering.

dataElement.name: Gathering
dataElement.annot: Elements describing the field events that created the unit and their location.

dataElement.name: Code
dataElement.annot: A string that identifies all material or records that resulted from a collecting or observation event.

dataElement.name: DateTime
dataElement.annot: Date(s) and time(s) of the collecting or observation event

dataElement.name: DateText
dataElement.annot: The date in text format

dataElement.name: TimeZone
dataElement.annot: The time zone to which the time-of-day data refer

dataElement.name: ISODateTimeBegin
dataElement.annot: The exact date (and time) or beginning of a period, expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

dataElement.name: DayNumberBegin
dataElement.annot: Julian day number in the year for the exact date or for the beginning day of a period

dataElement.name: TimeOfDayBegin
dataElement.annot: Time of day in hours from midnight for an exact point in time or for the beginning of a time period

dataElement.name: ISODateTimeEnd
dataElement.annot: The end of a period expressed in a modified ISO/ANSI 8601 standard structured format

dataElement.name: DayNumberEnd
dataElement.annot: The Julian day number of the last day in a period.

dataElement.name: TimeOfDayEnd
dataElement.annot: Time of day in hours from midnight for the end of a time period

dataElement.name: PeriodExplicit
dataElement.annot: Set to True if the event takes place for the period indicated, set to false if it occurs at some point of time during the period, not filled if unknown or no period specified.

dataElement.name: Agents
dataElement.annot: A container element for the agent(s) responsible for collecting or recording.

dataElement.name: GatheringAgent
dataElement.annot: The person, or one of the persons or team(s) or organization(s) responsible for collecting or recording. Attributes: a flag indicating the primary collector, and a sequence number.

dataElement.name: AgentText
dataElement.annot: Free text details for Agent.

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: Agent organization name and code(s).

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.name: Abbreviation
dataElement.annot: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

dataElement.name: OrgUnits
dataElement.annot: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: OrgUnit
dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: Person
dataElement.annot: Agent Person details.

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: InheritedName
dataElement.annot: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

dataElement.name: Prefix
dataElement.annot: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

dataElement.name: Suffix
dataElement.annot: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: GatheringAgentsText
dataElement.annot: Free text representation or concatenated version of those responsible for collecting or recording.

dataElement.name: Permits
dataElement.annot: A container element for references to (or texts of) permits related to the gathering.

dataElement.name: Project
dataElement.annot: Project information concerning the gathering event.

dataElement.name: ProjectTitle
dataElement.annot: Title of collection project

dataElement.name: Contact
dataElement.annot: Contact details for Project Officer or other person with knowledge of the project.

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: Organisation to contact

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.name: Abbreviation
dataElement.annot: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

dataElement.name: OrgUnits
dataElement.annot: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: OrgUnit
dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: Person
dataElement.annot: Person to contact

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: InheritedName
dataElement.annot: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

dataElement.name: Prefix
dataElement.annot: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

dataElement.name: Suffix
dataElement.annot: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.annot: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

dataElement.name: Addresses
dataElement.annot: Contact addresses (one preferred, different languages possible)

dataElement.name: Address
dataElement.annot: Contact address as string.

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumbers
dataElement.annot: Telephone and fax numbers

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumber
dataElement.annot: Telephone or fax number

dataElement.name: Number
dataElement.annot: Full number in standard international format

dataElement.name: UsageNotes
dataElement.annot: Free text for constraints on use e.g. "weekdays only" or "home number"

dataElement.name: EmailAddresses
dataElement.annot: E-mail addresses

dataElement.name: EmailAddress
dataElement.annot: E-mail address for contact

dataElement.name: URIs
dataElement.annot: URIs for person or organisation

dataElement.name: URL
dataElement.annot: URI for person or organisation

dataElement.name: LogoURI
dataElement.annot: URL of a logo image.

dataElement.name: PlatformName
dataElement.annot: The 'platform' from which observations or collections were made, e.g. the name of a research vessel or a remote operated vehicle.

dataElement.name: Method
dataElement.annot: The method (including technical means) used to make the collection or observation.

dataElement.name: LocalityText
dataElement.annot: Original locality data as appearing on a label or in an original entry.

dataElement.name: Country
dataElement.annot: Details of the country. Separate from NamedArea for compatibility reasons.

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Name of country or major region for specimen or observation

dataElement.name: NameDerived
dataElement.annot: Derived name of country or major region for specimen or observation

dataElement.name: ISO3166Code
dataElement.annot: 2- or 3-letter (ISO3166-1) or 4-letter (ISO3166-3) code for representation of name of country or origin.

dataElement.name: NamedAreas
dataElement.annot: Atomised place names as applied to the collection or observation site; with possibility for hierarchical structuring and categorization.

dataElement.name: NamedArea
dataElement.annot: Atomised place name with possibility for hierarchical structuring. Attribute for sequence.

dataElement.name: AreaClass
dataElement.annot: Allows recording of categories for local or national subdivision levels, geomorphological units, protected areas, etc.

dataElement.name: AreaName
dataElement.annot: Name of a geographic, geomorphological, geoecological, or administrative area.

dataElement.name: AreaCodeStandard
dataElement.annot: Standard coding scheme the AreaCode adheres to.

dataElement.name: AreaCode
dataElement.annot: Abbreviation or code for area names

dataElement.name: NearNamedPlaces
dataElement.annot: Specified relationship to a named place that does not directly apply to the site of collection or observation, e. g. 10 Km South of Mytown.

dataElement.name: NearNamedPlace
dataElement.annot: The nearest named place to the collection or observation location

dataElement.name: NearNamedPlaceRelationTo
dataElement.annot: Distance and directional point.

dataElement.name: AreaDetail
dataElement.annot: Free text description of further details pertaining to the observation, sampling, or collection locality which which did not fit into the previous elements.

dataElement.name: GML
dataElement.annot: Spaceholder for GML-conformant schema extension to express the spatial representation of the gathering locality including coordinates, footprint, and uncertainties in GML (Geographical Markup Language). The GML application schema developed by the BioGeomancer Project (see http:\\www.biogeomancer.org) can be used here.

dataElement.name: WFS
dataElement.annot: Retrieval of a boundary polygon or centroid spatial reference relating to the gathering site. URL (GET) or POST text, for Web Feature Service (OpenGIS Consortium Specification 01-023) reference.

dataElement.name: WMSURL
dataElement.annot: URI (e.g. web address) for the location of a boundary polygon or centroid spatial reference relating to a gathering site, according to the Web Map Services (WMS) specification of the Open GIS Consortium

dataElement.name: SiteCoordinateSets
dataElement.annot: Container for multiple sets of coordinates indicating the site of collection or observation.

dataElement.name: SiteCoordinates
dataElement.annot: Attributes for Original data and for begin and end of sequence . Composite element to allow recording multiple coordinates or same coordinate in different systems

dataElement.name: CoordinateMethod
dataElement.annot: Coordinates measuring system e.g. GPS, field map reference, inferred map reference

dataElement.name: GeoreferenceSources
dataElement.annot: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4:] A list of maps, gazetteers or other resources used to georeference the locality. The content of this concept is meant to be specific enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resource to georeference the same locality. Example: "USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad".

dataElement.name: GeoreferenceVerificationStatus
dataElement.annot: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4:] A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the location where the specimen or observation was collected. This element should be vocabulary-controlled. Examples: "requires verification", "verified by collector", "verified by curator".

dataElement.name: GeoreferenceRemarks
dataElement.annot: [DwC Geospatial Extension v. 1.4:] Comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in GeoreferenceProtocol.

dataElement.name: UTMZone
dataElement.annot: The numerical Zone corresponding to the central meridian and origin upon which the UTMEasting is based.

dataElement.name: UTMSubzone
dataElement.annot: The Subzone letter corresponding to one of the 20 North-South divisions of the UTM grid system.

dataElement.name: UTMNS
dataElement.annot: The hemisphere to which the UTMNorthing refers.

dataElement.name: UTMZoneFull
dataElement.annot: An alternative composite text to capture a zone expressed as a combination of UTMZone and UTMSubzone.

dataElement.name: UTMEasting
dataElement.annot: The distance in meters east of the origin of the UTMZone.

dataElement.name: UTMNorthing
dataElement.annot: The distance in meters north of the origin for the UTMSubzone.

dataElement.name: UTMDatum
dataElement.annot: Mathematical surface on which the mapping and coordinate system used for the geocodes of the record are based.

dataElement.name: UTMText
dataElement.annot: A alternative composite text to capture unatomized UTM coordinate data.

dataElement.name: CoordinatesGrid
dataElement.annot: Geospatial coordinates recorded using a grid system

dataElement.name: GridCellSystem
dataElement.annot: Grid system name e.g. "GB OS"

dataElement.name: GridQualifier
dataElement.annot: Grid reference precision qualifier

dataElement.name: CoordinatesLatLong
dataElement.annot: Element that allows the recording of the latitude and longitude of a recording or collecting position. Could be simplified by converting many of the sub-elements into attributes.

dataElement.name: LongitudeDecimal
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Longitude. Express in decimal degrees

dataElement.name: VerbatimLongitude
dataElement.annot: Equivalent to the respective element in DwC Geospatial Extension v.1.4.

dataElement.name: LatitudeDecimal
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Latitude. Express in decimal degrees

dataElement.name: VerbatimLatitude
dataElement.annot: Equivalent to the respective element in DwC Geospatial Extension v.1.4.

dataElement.name: SpatialDatum
dataElement.annot: Mathematical surface on which the mapping and coordinate system used for the geocodes of the record are based

dataElement.name: AccuracyStatement
dataElement.annot: Free text statement of degree of accuracy

dataElement.name: CoordinateErrorDistanceInMeters
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Coordinate Precision. An estimate of how tightly the collecting locality was specified; expressed as a distance in meters corresponding to a radius around the Lat/Long coordinates. Use NULL where precision is unknown, cannot be estimated or is not applicable.

dataElement.name: PointRadiusSpatialFit
dataElement.annot: Equivalent to the respective element in DwC Geospatial Extension v.1.4.

dataElement.name: Altitude
dataElement.annot: The altitude of the gathering site land or floor level given as distance above (positive) or below mean sea level.

dataElement.name: MeasuredBy
dataElement.annot: Attribution of the measurement to a Person

dataElement.name: MeasurementDateTime
dataElement.annot: Date and/or Time the measurement was taken

dataElement.name: Duration
dataElement.annot: Duration of measurement in time.

dataElement.name: Method
dataElement.annot: Method used to make measurement.

dataElement.name: Parameter
dataElement.annot: Describes type of measurement or fact, such as width, abundance, circumference, temperature etc. or color etc.

dataElement.name: AppliesTo
dataElement.annot: Depending on the use of the type, this can further specify the actual part measured. For example, a measurement of temperature may be a surface, air or sub-surface measurement.

dataElement.name: LowerValue
dataElement.annot: Lower or only value or fact text.

dataElement.name: UpperValue
dataElement.annot: Upper value where there is a range.

dataElement.name: UnitOfMeasurement
dataElement.annot: Unit of measurement.

dataElement.name: Accuracy
dataElement.annot: Statement of accuracy of measurement.

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFactReference
dataElement.annot: Reference (publication) where this measurement was taken from

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: IsQuantitative
dataElement.annot: Flag indicating if the value represents the numerical result of a quantitative measurement (TRUE) or a descriptor with textual or categorical result (FALSE).

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFactText
dataElement.annot: Free text alternative to atomised version.

dataElement.name: Depth
dataElement.annot: Vertical distance point or range measurement in relation to a ground datum such as water level, or level of the sea floor for benthic samples.

dataElement.name: SiteImages
dataElement.annot: Images taken at the Gathering site

dataElement.name: ID
dataElement.annot: Identifier for the multimedia object. May be a filename.

dataElement.name: FileURI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier of the underlying multimedia file, i.e. "naked" path to electronic source of multimedia object (e.g. web address). See also

dataElement.name: ProductURI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier of an electronic source of multimedia object including HTML, Javascript or similar means deliver rendered output.

dataElement.name: Context
dataElement.annot: The context of the object in relation to the specimen or observation. E.g. image of entire specimen, sound recording the observation is based on, image of original valid publication, etc.

dataElement.name: Format
dataElement.annot: Code or descriptive term for file or object format e.g. jpg, pcx, tiff for digital images; 16mm, beta video, AVI, mpg for moving images; transparency, print for photographs etc.

dataElement.name: ImageSize
dataElement.annot: Image size in pixels x pixels.

dataElement.name: Width
dataElement.annot: Picture width in pixel

dataElement.name: Height
dataElement.annot: Picture height in pixel

dataElement.name: ImageResolution
dataElement.annot: Resolution expressed in dots per inch.

dataElement.name: FileSize
dataElement.annot: Size in Kb of the file referred to by URI or filename.

dataElement.name: IPR
dataElement.annot: Intellectual Property Rights relating specifically to the image.

dataElement.name: IPRDeclarations
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: IPRDeclaration
dataElement.annot: Used where the IPR declaration cannot be parsed into the specific items or for forms of IPR declaration not yet covered (e.g. database rights),

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: A concise representation of a statement, recommended to be as short as possible, but actual length is unconstrained.

dataElement.name: Details
dataElement.annot: Optional text of unconstrained length, elaborating details of the ShortText

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: An optional resource on the net providing details on the statement (may be used as an alternative to the long text).

dataElement.name: Copyrights
dataElement.annot: Container element for one to several statements, normally representing different language representations of the same content.

dataElement.name: Copyright
dataElement.annot: Copyright may include the information that the data has been released to the public domain.

dataElement.name: License
dataElement.annot: To be used if data are placed under a public license (GPL, GFDL, OpenDocument). Placing data under a public license while maintaining copyright is recommended!

dataElement.name: TermsOfUse
dataElement.annot: Defines conditions under which the data may be analised, distributed or changed. "Terms of use" includes concepts like "Usage conditions" and "Specific Restrictions".

dataElement.annot: Depending on the use of the type, this can further specify the actual part measured. For example, a measurement of temperature may be a surface, air or sub-surface measurement.

dataElement.name: LowerValue
dataElement.annot: Lower or only value or fact text.

dataElement.name: UpperValue
dataElement.annot: Upper value where there is a range.

dataElement.name: UnitOfMeasurement
dataElement.annot: Unit of measurement.

dataElement.name: Accuracy
dataElement.annot: Statement of accuracy of measurement.

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFactReference
dataElement.annot: Reference (publication) where this measurement was taken from

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: IsQuantitative
dataElement.annot: Flag indicating if the value represents the numerical result of a quantitative measurement (TRUE) or a descriptor with textual or categorical result (FALSE).

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFactText
dataElement.annot: Free text alternative to atomised version.

dataElement.name: Synecology
dataElement.annot: Relationship of the unit gathered with other taxa at the gathering site

dataElement.name: Syntaxon
dataElement.annot: A syntaxon name and category assigned to the gathering site.

dataElement.name: Comment
dataElement.annot: Free text comment on synecological features of the gathering site.

dataElement.name: AssociatedTaxa
dataElement.annot: Other taxa observed at the gathering site

dataElement.name: TaxonIdentified
dataElement.annot: Other taxon found at the gathering site

dataElement.name: HigherTaxa
dataElement.annot: Wrapper element for multiple designations of higher taxa. These are higher-level classifications of the name identified, NOT a higher taxon as the sole identification.

dataElement.name: HigherTaxon
dataElement.annot: The scientific name of a taxon with a rank higher than Genus which is commonly used to classify the group the unit belongs to.

dataElement.name: ScientificName
dataElement.annot: Name of the taxon identified, formed according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names - with additional elements for suffixes or other expressions commonly used in taxonomic identifications.

dataElement.name: FullScientificNameString
dataElement.annot: Concatenated scientific name, preferrably formed in accordance with a Code of Nomenclature, i. e. a monomial, bionomial, or trinomial plus author(s) or author team(s) and - where relevant - year, or the name of a cultivar or cultivar group, or a hybrid formula, as fully as possible.

dataElement.name: NameAtomised
dataElement.annot: Atomised data items of the taxon identified, with subtypes according to the different Codes of Nomenclature which apply to scientific names.

dataElement.name: Bacterial
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Nomenclature of Prokaryotes

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus name.

dataElement.name: Subgenus
dataElement.annot: Subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SubgenusAuthorAndYear
dataElement.annot: Author team and year of the subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SpeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Species epithet

dataElement.name: SubspeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Subspecies

dataElement.name: ParentheticalAuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: Author team and Year of the basionym of a species or subspecies combination.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: The author(s) who published the full name as it stands and its year.

dataElement.name: NameApprobation
dataElement.annot: Approbation of name according to approved list, validation list,or validly published, paper in IJSB after 1980.

dataElement.name: Botanical
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name.

dataElement.name: FirstEpithet
dataElement.annot: The first epithet in a botanical name combination (species epithet or the epithet of the subdivision of a genus.

dataElement.name: InfraspecificEpithet
dataElement.annot: The final epithet of a botanical name of infraspecific rank.

dataElement.name: Rank
dataElement.annot: The rank of the name where needed to form it.

dataElement.name: HybridFlag
dataElement.annot: Flag indicating that this is a named hybrid or a graft chimaera.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamParenthesis
dataElement.annot: Author team of the basionym of a combination.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeam
dataElement.annot: The author(s) who published the full name as it stands.

dataElement.name: CultivarGroupName
dataElement.annot: Cultivar group name

dataElement.name: CultivarName
dataElement.annot: Cultivar name according to the ICNCP.

dataElement.name: TradeDesignationNames
dataElement.annot: Container for trade names

dataElement.name: TradeDesignationName
dataElement.annot: Trade name used for a specific cultivar

dataElement.name: Zoological
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name.

dataElement.name: Subgenus
dataElement.annot: Subgenus name.

dataElement.name: SpeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Species epithet

dataElement.name: SubspeciesEpithet
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Subspecies

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamOriginalAndYear
dataElement.annot: The first person(s) who validly published a species-group name and the year of publication.

dataElement.name: AuthorTeamParenthesisAndYear
dataElement.annot: The parenthetical citation of the original author when a species-group was transferred to another genus and the year of the original publication.

dataElement.name: CombinationAuthorTeamAndYear
dataElement.annot: The citation of the authors responsible for the new combination and the year of its publication.

dataElement.name: Breed
dataElement.annot: Name of the breed of an animal

dataElement.name: Viral
dataElement.annot: Atomised name with elements according to the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses

dataElement.name: GenusOrMonomial
dataElement.annot: Genus or higher taxon name formed according to the code and representing the result of the identification. E.g. Comovirus.

dataElement.name: ViralSpeciesDesignation
dataElement.annot: The formal name of a viral species. Examples: vaccinia virus; human herpes virus 2 (herpes simplex virus 2); poliovirus 1; Saccharomyces cerevisiae virus L-A; enterobacteria phage PRD1 [Source: ICTV].

dataElement.name: Acronym
dataElement.annot: The accepted acronym for the Virus, e.g. PCV for Peanut Clump Virus.

dataElement.name: IdentificationQualifier
dataElement.annot: A term to qualify the identification of the unit when doubts have arisen as to its identity (e.g. "cf." or "aff."). If it applies to an atomised name, the attribute insertionpoint defines the name element in front of which the qualifier should be inserted (1 = before entire name, 2= before first epithet, 3 = before second epithet.)

dataElement.name: NameAddendum
dataElement.annot: A free-text suffix added to the taxon identified (e.g. "sensu lato"), or an additional name element in common use but without formal nomenclatural standing (e.g. Isolate names for viruses).

dataElement.name: InformalNameString
dataElement.annot: The outcome of an identification event that does not adhere to the rule of a Code of Nomenclature.

dataElement.name: NameComments
dataElement.annot: Any free text comments related to the name

dataElement.name: Code
dataElement.annot: The Code of Nomenclature that applies to the scientific name.

dataElement.name: Aspect
dataElement.annot: Facing direction (aspect) of whole site or sample point.

dataElement.name: Ordination
dataElement.annot: The direction, orientation or aspect of slope expressed in compass points

dataElement.name: CompassBearing
dataElement.annot: Orientation or bearing from North

dataElement.name: Accuracy
dataElement.annot: Accuracy of aspect reading or estimation

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Text expression of slope or aspect

dataElement.name: Notes
dataElement.annot: Further text referring to the gathering event that does not fit one of the elements specified.

dataElement.name: CollectorsFieldNumber
dataElement.annot: A number assigned to the unit by the collector or observer. Note that the respective collector's name is found under gathering (GatheringAgents).

dataElement.name: MeasurementsOrFacts
dataElement.annot: A container for quantitative and categorical measurements (including observations) refering to the unit, e.g. counts, size measurements, colours, etc.

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFact
dataElement.annot: Quantitative or categorical measurement refering to the unit.

dataElement.name: MeasuredBy
dataElement.annot: Attribution of the measurement to a Person

dataElement.name: MeasurementDateTime
dataElement.annot: Date and/or Time the measurement was taken

dataElement.name: Duration
dataElement.annot: Duration of measurement in time.

dataElement.name: Method
dataElement.annot: Method used to make measurement.

dataElement.name: Parameter
dataElement.annot: Describes type of measurement or fact, such as width, abundance, circumference, temperature etc. or color etc.

dataElement.name: AppliesTo
dataElement.annot: Depending on the use of the type, this can further specify the actual part measured. For example, a measurement of temperature may be a surface, air or sub-surface measurement.

dataElement.name: LowerValue
dataElement.annot: Lower or only value or fact text.

dataElement.name: UpperValue
dataElement.annot: Upper value where there is a range.

dataElement.name: UnitOfMeasurement
dataElement.annot: Unit of measurement.

dataElement.name: Accuracy
dataElement.annot: Statement of accuracy of measurement.

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFactReference
dataElement.annot: Reference (publication) where this measurement was taken from

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: IsQuantitative
dataElement.annot: Flag indicating if the value represents the numerical result of a quantitative measurement (TRUE) or a descriptor with textual or categorical result (FALSE).

dataElement.name: MeasurementOrFactText
dataElement.annot: Free text alternative to atomised version.

dataElement.name: Sex
dataElement.annot: Maps to Darwin Core 2: Sex. Refers to the entire unit, which may be mixed. Note that counts can be provided in the Unit's MeasurementsOrFacts section.

dataElement.name: Age
dataElement.annot: Age of the organism at the time of collection or observation. Note that counts for different age classes can be provied in the Unit's MeasurementsOrFacts section.

dataElement.name: Sequences
dataElement.annot: Container for medata on sequences derived from this unit.

dataElement.name: Database
dataElement.annot: E.g. GenBank, SwissProt, etc. Use "Internal" for unpublished sequence.

dataElement.name: ID-in-Database
dataElement.annot: E.g. GenBank accession number.

dataElement.name: Method
dataElement.annot: A description of the method used to achive the sequence.

dataElement.name: SequencedPart
dataElement.annot: Description of the actually sequenced material (DNA/RNA/Protein, Gene or part of gene, completeness, etc.),

dataElement.name: Reference
dataElement.annot: Reference where the sequence was published.

dataElement.name: TitleCitation
dataElement.annot: Formal citation for a paper or electronic publication.

dataElement.name: CitationDetail
dataElement.annot: Specific page, figure or illustration number(s) within the reference.

dataElement.name: URI
dataElement.annot: Universal Resource Identifier - Path to electronic source of document.

dataElement.name: SequencingAgent
dataElement.annot: The person and/or organisation responisible and/or effecting the sequencing.

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.annot: Organisation to contact

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.annot: Full organization or corporate name in multiple languages (en: 'Botanical Garden of ...', de: 'Botanischer Garten von ...'). vCard:Org.OrgName). The Label mechanism also supports acronyms / abbreviations (no vCard equivalent!).

dataElement.name: Representation
dataElement.annot: Language-specific label representation [ATTR: language]

dataElement.name: Text
dataElement.annot: Label text in a specific language.

dataElement.name: Abbreviation
dataElement.annot: Restricted to 50 characters maximum length, including blanks (recommended to be shorter!). Label abbreviations are especially important when displaying information in a tabular format.

dataElement.name: OrgUnits
dataElement.annot: If the contact contains no person definition: the unit within the organization the agent represents; else a list of the various organisational units to which a person may belong. (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: OrgUnit
dataElement.annot: (vCard:OrgUnit)

dataElement.name: Person
dataElement.annot: Person to contact

dataElement.name: FullName
dataElement.annot: Preferred form of personal name for display as a string.

dataElement.name: SortingName
dataElement.annot: The full name with the elements in preferred sorting sequence (vCard: Sort-String).

dataElement.name: InheritedName
dataElement.annot: Family names, generational names, clan name, parents/grandparents personal names, etc. This (= last name in western cultures) may be compound ('Fischer von Waldheim', 'da Selva', 'Silvano Morales'). Depending on culture it is not necessarily the name of the parents nor common to the married couple and children, thus 'family name' should be avoided even though used in vCard. (vCard:N.Family)

dataElement.name: Prefix
dataElement.annot: Prefix to inherited name that should be output before name, but is usually not included in sorting. Examples: 'von', 'Lord'. Compare Title for 'Prof', 'Dr.' (vCard:N.Prefix)

dataElement.name: Suffix
dataElement.annot: Suffix to name that should be output after name, regardless whether it is in sorting sequence (Inherited, Given) or not. Examples: 'Jun.', 'III.'. (vCard:N.Suffix)

dataElement.name: GivenNames
dataElement.annot: The name given to a person as a personal name (= first or christian name in western cultures, including 'middle initials') may contain several words ('Ana Maria', 'Jerry B.'). Applicable only to persons. (vCard:N.Given + vCard:N.Middle)

dataElement.name: PreferredName
dataElement.annot: May differ from the first given name: second given name, nickname ('Bob' for 'Robert'), etc. (vCard:Nickname)

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.annot: Analogue to vCard:Role: Functional contact name, e.g. "Database administrator", "The Director", etc.

dataElement.name: Addresses
dataElement.annot: Contact addresses (one preferred, different languages possible)

dataElement.name: Address
dataElement.annot: Contact address as string.

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumbers
dataElement.annot: Telephone and fax numbers

dataElement.name: TelephoneNumber
dataElement.annot: Telephone or fax number

dataElement.name: Number
dataElement.annot: Full number in standard international format

dataElement.name: UsageNotes
dataElement.annot: Free text for constraints on use e.g. "weekdays only" or "home number"

dataElement.name: EmailAddresses
dataElement.annot: E-mail addresses

dataElement.name: EmailAddress
dataElement.annot: E-mail address for contact

dataElement.name: URIs
dataElement.annot: URIs for person or organisation

dataElement.name: URL
dataElement.annot: URI for person or organisation

dataElement.name: LogoURI
dataElement.annot: URL of a logo image.

dataElement.name: Length
dataElement.annot: Length of the sequence in basepairs

dataElement.name: Notes
dataElement.annot: Miscellaneous notes referring to the unit that do not fit elsewhere.

dataElement.name: RecordURI
dataElement.annot: Gives the web address of the page where more information on this particular record (not on the whole dataset) can be found. [OBIS]

dataElement.name: EAnnotations
dataElement.annot: Annotations in electronic form not (yet) added to the physical specimen.

dataElement.name: UnitExtension
dataElement.annot: The extension is temporary and serves only to accommodate urgent inter-version additions to the unit-object schema [in future to the the various schemas/objects used in ABCD]. For example, if a specific community (e.g. culture collections) discover that there are elements missing in the current version of ABCD (as they did for 1.2), they communicate that to the group responsible for schema development, where it will be discussed if these elements are already accommodated in the schema, if not, if they can and should be generalized and where they should end up in the schema. IF the culture collection community needs to move rapidly (e.g. due to project pressures), they can add these elements to the current version as an extension schema under a structure that follows SDD's CustomExtensions element (CustomExtensions-CustomExtension-Any ##other). In future modular versions of ABCD, such a structure should exist in the root of every object/schema.
